result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Peter Culotti was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges. Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $100.00 per month with the first payment due on 11/14/2017 and additional payments due the 14th of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court.
Concurrent with: With any other sentence, with credit for 2 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing after revocation. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

As to Count 2:
The Court ordered defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 280 days time served, STRAIGHT TIME. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, fees and surcharges. Court ordered a payment plan in the amount of $100.00 per month with the first payment due on 11/14/2017 and additional payments due the 14th of each month thereafter.  If there are any missed payments any remaining balance will be due FORTHWITH and an immediate entry of a civil judgment is ordered by the court. 

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
received and filed.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Yang Br.47 for review. os

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

 Sentencing proceeded as to Count TWO:   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 3 days time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS to commence upon completion of sentences in case 15cm3225 and 15cm2303 with the following conditions:
*restitution in the amount of $55.00 to Kenneth S. through atty Ertl's trust account , forthwith
*pay all mandatory costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
Violation report of missed office contact, received and filed

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT TWO: 
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

ON MOTION OF THE STATE COURT ORDERED COUNT ONE:  DISMISSED AND READ IN AS TO SENTENCING. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 11, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 10-13-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Ryan P Culotti in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT.  Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Court held colloquy with defendant. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Ertl to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $50.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at the conclusion of the case. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned for a Status of Counsel date in branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.

Defendant Ryan Peter Culotti in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Status Conference in Br.47.vb
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 4/27/15 @ 1:30pm
